item.description:
Hands Up (Les mains en l’air) by Romain Goupil (2010, 90 min.). From the year 2067, Milana looks back to the present day when she was a young Chechen immigrant in Paris, and her school friends plotted together to help save her from deportation. Director Romain Goupil ( a former assistant to Jean-Luc Godard) has drawn brilliant and honest performances out of the young cast through a series of improvisations. This charming and thought-provoking film had a Special Event Screening at Cannes and has met with international critical success. Shot digitally with a sense of keen urgency, the timely film bravely tackles the question of immigration in contemporary France from all sides, but without ever preaching.

 

The Boston French Film Festival is co-presented with the Cultural Services Office of the French Consulate in Boston.

A selection for the French Film Festival at the MFA, this film has an interesting premise, and is directed by a Godardist.  Might be the the perfect preview for the annual Godard film scheduled for this group July 17.

After the film, we'll go to Pizzeria Uno for great discussion, and hold our hands up whenever the wait staff asks 'who wants more wine?'

See you at the movie,

 

John

 

p.s. - I'm linking this to Facebook.  Please let me know if you 'find' it.  We're thinking of creating a Facebook Page for our group to broaden our reach.  Let me know what you think, or if you have any other ideas.
item.how_to_find_us: John will be sitting in the middle of the 3rd or 4th row, hold up the sign in the lobby after, and lead the group to Pizzeria Uno. If you miss us at any point, come to Pizzeria Uno and look for the group with their hands up in the air.
